page.description: Moves focus to the next control, as if the user pressed the "Tab" key.

item.name: Browses (for <OBJECT> use either the <BROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for <OBJECT> use either the <FORM> pointer or the name of the form)

section.description: The <OBJECT>.NEXT() method moves the focus to the next control in the tab order as if the user had pressed the Tab key. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

page.original:
&ltOBJECT>.NEXT() Syntax &ltOBJECT>.NEXT() Description The &ltOBJECT>.NEXT() method applies to:
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.NEXT() method moves the focus to the next control in the tab order as if the user had pressed the Tab key. Limitations Desktop applications only. Example :customer.next()
See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
